Constructor Detail

MusicLib

public MusicLib()
Method Detail

sum

public static double[] sum(double[] a,
                           double[] b,
                           double awt,
                           double bwt)
Description of sum(double[] a, double[] b, double awt, double bwt) Returns an array of double data types, which essentially is a weighted sine curve that is a combination of input sine curves, that when passed through StdAudio.play(), plays both sounds at the same time. It is similar to pressing two notes on the piano at the same time.

Parameters:
a - this is an array of double data types which represents a sine curve (a sound).
b - this is the 2nd array of double data types which also is a sine curve representing a sound.
awt - this is the wanted weight of sound 'a' - if it is < 0.5, it will have low volume; if it is > 0.5, it will have high volume. awt is proportional to the volume.
bwt - same thing as awt but for sound 'b'.
Returns:
an array of double data types that is a "weighted average" of the two inputed sounds.

pitch

public static double[] pitch(double hz,
                             double duration)
Description of pitch(double hz, double duration) Create a pure pitch of the given frequency for the given duration. This basically is the bread and butter of the overall program; it turns a given frequency of a note (i.e A) into a sound sine wave that can be interpreted by StdAudio.Play.

Parameters:
hz - this is the inputed frequency that the user wants to create into a sine wave.
duration - this is how long the user wants the sound to last (aka how long the sine wave is).
Returns:
a "sine wave" that is in the form of an array containing double data types.

note

public static double[] note(int pitch,
                            double t)
Description of note(int pitch, double t) Creates a note with harmonies of of the given pitch, where 0 = concert A. Basically, this method returns an array of double data types that is the sound of a note, a note of same type (i.e A) 1 octave lower, and a note of same type 1 octave higher.

Parameters:
pitch - this is a piano note value (i.e 0 = concert A, 1 = B, etc.) that the user wants to make harmonies with.
t - this is the duration that the user wants the sound to last.
Returns:
a "sine wave" that is in the form of an array containing double data types, which contains a note and its octave neighbors.

createMajorChord

public static double[] createMajorChord(int pitch,
                                        double t)
Description of createMajorChord(int pitch, double t) Creates a major chord with a stem note (pitch), and the 4th major interval note and the 7th major interval note.

Parameters:
pitch - this is a piano note value (i.e 0 = concert A, 1 = B, etc.) that the user wants to make the stem note of a MajorChord with.
t - this is the duration that the user wants the chord to last.
Returns:
a "sine wave" that is in the form of an array containing double data types, which contains a stem note 'pitch' and its 4th major interval note and 7th major interval note to form a majorchord sound.

createMinorChord

public static double[] createMinorChord(int pitch,
                                        double t)
Description of createMinorChord(int pitch, double t) Creates a minor chord with a stem note (pitch), and the 3rd minor interval note and the 7th major interval note.

Parameters:
pitch - this is a piano note value (i.e 0 = concert A, 1 = B, etc.) that the user wants to make the stem note of a MinorChord with.
t - this is the duration that the user wants the chord to last.
Returns:
a "sine wave" that is in the form of an array containing double data types, which contains a stem note 'pitch' and its 3rd minor interval note and 7th major interval note to form a minorchord sound.

VolumeChanger

public static double[] VolumeChanger(double numA,
                                     double[] A)
Description of VolumeChanger(double numA, double[] A) Basically changes the volume given a sound (in the form of a double[] array)

Parameters:
numA - the ratio of volume change; give it 1.2, 20% louder. give it 0.8, 20% quieter.
A - the sound that is to be volume changed.
Returns:
a double[] array that has changed volume!

Delay

public static int Delay(int initialnote)
Description of Delay(int intial note) Takes a note and spits it back out to be played again; however, the echo'ed note has changed volume, because delayyesno turns to true. This boolean value triggers a change in volume in the main args area of the program.

Parameters:
initialnote - the note that is to be 'delayed'
Returns:
echonote the new note that is the same frequency as the old note and is played again in the program
